dt: {bc}proceeding from the will or from one's own choice or consent
{bc}acting or done of one's own free will without valuable consideration or legal obligation
{bc}of, relating to, subject to, or regulated by the will

pt: {sc}voluntary{/sc} {sc}intentional{/sc} {sc}deliberate{/sc} {sc}willing{/sc} mean done or brought about of one's own will. {sc}voluntary{/sc} implies freedom and spontaneity of choice or action without external compulsion.
{sc}intentional{/sc} stresses an awareness of an end to be achieved.
{sc}deliberate{/sc} implies full consciousness of the nature of one's act and its consequences.
{sc}willing{/sc} implies a readiness and eagerness to accede to or anticipate the wishes of another.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}voluntarie{/it}, from Latin {it}voluntarius{/it}, from {it}voluntas{/it} will, from {it}velle{/it} to will, wish {ma}{mat|will|}{/ma}
shortdef: proceeding from the will or from one's own choice or consent
done by design or intention : intentional
